intro: Actinocyclus, commonly known as a type of colonial diatom, is a genus of microscopic algae belonging to the class Bacillariophyceae. These organisms are characterized by their intricate silica cell walls, known as frustules, which exhibit radial symmetry. Actinocyclus species typically form spherical or disc-shaped colonies, with individual cells arranged in a star-like pattern. They are commonly found in freshwater environments, such as lakes and ponds, where they play a vital role in aquatic ecosystems. Due to their unique morphology and ecological significance, they are often used in paleolimnological studies to assess water quality and environmental changes.
